message: Director IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur's post. “You can’t buy happiness but you can buy books and they are kind of the same thing” But what if you didn’t have to buy them? What if you could just share one and find a friend in return? IWG presents the event ‘Novel Exchange’ to set afoot this tradition. Let’s take this initiating step that’ll interweave Kgpian hearts. Come out with a book close to your heart which you’d like share and submit it. Receive another book that you’d like to read and enjoy. Meet the borrower or lender of your book to discuss it over a cup of chai or a walk around 2.2 and Congratulations, you now have two new friends! Nominate your booklover friends to come out and do the same, there’s no better way to get those introverts out of their rooms. Venue: Stalls in front of Gymkhana, CCD and MT Bring a Book: 5-7 pm ; 22nd August (Wednesday) Take a Book: 8-10 pm ; 23rd August (Thursday) Agreement: I hereby declare that I take full responsibility of taking care of the condition of this book and not tampering with it. I agree to return the book to its rightful owner by the third week of October. If I don’t meet the above requirements or lose the book by chance, I accept to face the consequences and return a sum of money chosen with propriety.

message: Director IIT Kharagpur shared Mamata Banerjee's post. Today, I was present in the 64th Annual Convocation of Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur along with the Hon’ble President of India and the Hon’ble Governor of West Bengal. It was indeed a wonderful experience to share some time with some of the brightest minds around. IIT, Kharagpur, by its name and fame, has a very distinctive place in the world. I once again extend my heartiest greetings and best wishes to all the students, awardees, their parents, teachers, well-wishers and the entire IIT, Kharagpur faculty on this momentous occasion. Some pictures of today’s event are uploaded here for all of you.

message: Director IIT Kharagpur shared Computer Science & Engineering Department, IIT Kharagpur's post. IIT Kharagpur is hosting this high-profile conference on Network Science and Digital Earth with North Eastern University from March 7-9, 2019. Department of Computer Science and Engineering is taking leading initiative to make it successful.

message: Director IIT Kharagpur shared Department of Science and Technology, Government of India's post. #Applications invited under '#Scheme for #Young #Scientists and #Technologists' to provide opportunities for pursuing #innovative #research ideas which have direct bearing on #societal problems as well as visible #technology transfer component. Last date 15 March 2018. For more details: http://dst.gov.in/callforproposals/scheme-young-scientists-and-technologists

Director IIT Kharagpur shared Indo-US Science and Technology Forum's post. The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India and Indo-U.S. Science & Technology Forum (IUSSTF) jointly announce a new fellowship program for Women “Indo-U.S. Fellowship for Women in STEMM (WISTEMM)” (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics and Medicine). The program aims to provide opportunities to Indian Women Scientists, Engineers & Technologists to undertake international collaborative research in premier institutions in U.S.A, to enhance their research capacities and capabilities. The deadline for submission of applications is 28th February 2018. More information about the Program is available on our website http://iusstf.org/story/53-108-Indo-U-S--Fellowship-for-Women-in-STEMM.html
